AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: leave out ‘entitled to’ and insert ‘eligible for’.
leave out ‘except as permitted’ and insert ‘other than by the child that is beneficially entitled to the investments under it or by a responsible person in circumstances specified’.

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: (f) provide that a responsible person may, at the time of opening an account, inform the account provider that he is a responsible person in Scotland.’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: leave out from ‘within’ to ‘apply’ in line 36 and insert ‘one year beginning with the day on which the voucher is issued’.
leave out ‘in accordance with regulations’ and add ‘within four weeks of receipt of the voucher’.
leave out ‘in accordance with regulations’ and insert ‘within four weeks of receipt of the application’.
leave out from ‘child’ to end of line 18.
at end add ‘provided that no transfer may take place without the agreement of a responsible person’.
leave out ‘such amount’ and insert ‘an amount no less than £250’.
leave out ‘such amount’ and insert ‘an amount no less than £250’.
leave out ‘entitled to’ and insert ‘eligible for’.
leave out from ‘date’ to end of line 17.
leave out from ‘of’ to end of line and insert ‘£50, or £100 for a child to whom section 9 applies’.
leave out from ‘attaining’ to end of line and insert ‘the age of seven’.
leave out from ‘attaining’ to end of line and insert ‘the ages of 5, 11 and 16’.
at end insert ‘provided that a person is shown to have acted fraudulently or negligently’.
after ‘year’, insert ‘shall be £1,200, or such greater amount as may be prescribed by regulations’.
after second ‘the’, insert ‘first day of the month that in-cludes the’.
leave out ‘immediately before’ and insert ‘on the first day of the month following that which includes’.

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: ‘( ) any person who assigns, or enters any agreement to assign, investments under a child trust fund or who charges on, or enters any agreement to charge, any such investments,’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: after ‘Act’, insert ‘except section [reduction of age of majority in respect of child trust funds]’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(2) Section [reduction of age of majority in respect of child trust funds] extends to Northern Ireland, but does not extend to Scotland.’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: at end add ‘and the Department for Work and Pensions’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(4) This Act (other than this section) shall not come into force until the Treasury has laid before each House of Parliament a report setting out the Treasury’s estimate of the net increase in saving which will result from the provisions of this Act.’.

‘(4) This Act (other than this section) shall not come into force until the Treasury and the Department for Work and Pensions have laid before each House of Parliament a joint report on the Government’s policies to improve savings incentives from birth to retirement.’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: at end insert ‘and it meets risk and transparency criteria set down by the Financial Services Authority’.

leave out ‘as’ and insert ‘from the accounts of children of over 16 years of where the child who holds the account wishes to withdraw an amount from the account and where permission has been secured from a responsible person and as otherwise’.
after ‘section’, insert ‘section [report on savings effect of child trust funds],’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(4) No order may be made under subsection (3) until the report specified in section [report on savings effect of child trust funds] has been laid before Parliament.’.
‘(4) No order may be made under subsection (3) until the report specified in section [report on savings incentives] has been laid before Parliament.’.

‘(6) Accounts and account providers selected by the Inland Revenue under subsection (1) shall meet lower risk criteria set out from time to time by the Financial Services Authority, designed to reduce the risks of significant capital losses from child trust fund accounts which have been opened or selected by the Inland Revenue.’.

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: ‘(c) a child trust fund opened by the Inland Revenue may be transferred from one account provider to another, or moved from a stakeholder child trust fund account to one of the other account descriptions as prescribed by regulations.’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(3) The initial contribution payable for children in care shall be set at four times the prevailing standard initial contribution amount.’.
‘(11) The supplementary contribution shall be fixed at an amount of not less than 100 per cent. of the initial contribution amount.’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: leave out from ‘attaining’ to end of line 18 and insert ‘the ages of 7, 11 and 15, or

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: (b) one-off payments are to be made to disburse the proceeds from Government asset sales.’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(6) Before this section comes into force the Treasury shall lay before each House of Parliament a report setting out the additional costs to the Exchequer over the period from 1st April 2004 to 31st March 2022 of relief from income tax and capital gains tax as a consequence of the introduction of child trust fund accounts, together with an assessment of the scope for greater tax avoidance activity.’.

‘(4) This Act does not come into force until the Treasury has laid before each House of Parliament a document setting out proposals for child trust fund accounts to become, on maturity, tax-advantaged accounts for retirement saving.’.

‘(6) This section shall not come into force until the Treasury has laid before each House of Parliament a report on how the saving gateway proposals will be applied to investments in child trust funds.’.

AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag.Amendment.Text_text: after ‘31’, insert ‘and subject to the provisions of sec-tion 13’.
after ‘section’, insert ‘section [proposals for conver-sion of child trust funds to tax-advantaged accounts for retirement saving],’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(4) No order may be made under subsection (3) until the report specified in section [proposals for conversion of child trust funds to tax-advantaged accounts for retirement saving] has been laid before Parliament.’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Reduction of age of majority in respect of child trust funds

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: For the purpose of any contract entered into in respect of a child trust fund, the age of majority shall be 16.
The Family Law Reform Act 1969 (c. 46) is amended as follows.
After section 1 insert—

ClauseTitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: “1A Reduction of age of majority in respect of child trust funds

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: For the purposes of any matter specified in subsection (2) which relates to a contract entered into in respect of a child trust fund, a person shall attain full age on attaining the age of sixteen.
Those matters are—

SubSection_PgfTag.Para_text: the construction (in the absence of a definition or of any indication of a contrary intention) of the expressions listed in section 1(2) and similar expressions in—

SubPara.SubPara_text: any statutory provision, whether passed or made before, on or after the date on which this section comes into force; and
any deed, will or other instrument of whatever nature (not being a statutory provision) made on or after that date.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: Subsections (6) and (7) of section 1 shall apply to the provisions of this section as they apply to the provisions of that section.
In this section ‘child trust fund’ has the meaning given by section 1(2) of the Child Trust Funds Act 2004.”
In section 28(4) (extent), after paragraph (a) insert—

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Report on savings effect of child trust funds

NewClause.Committee.ClauseText: ‘The Treasury shall lay before each House of Parliament a report setting out the Treasury’s estimate of the net increase in saving which will result from the provisions of this Act.’.
‘The Treasury and the Department for Work and Pensions shall lay before each House of Parliament a joint report on the Government’s policies to improve savings incentives from birth to retirement.’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Proposals for conversion of child trust funds to tax-advantaged accounts for retirement saving

NewClause.Committee.ClauseText: ‘The Treasury shall lay before each House of Parliament a report setting out proposals for child trust fund accounts to become, on maturity, tax-advantaged accounts for retirement saving.’.
